title: (x) Polynesian Fantasy invitation - Tagliente {Mike F}
content:
I am working on this invite and I am trying to match this font. Does anyone know what this might be?

much thanks:)

JM

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Fonts.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010134254/http:/typophile.com/files/Fonts.gif) | 51.75 KB |

 [‹ Sky Captain and The World of Tomorrow movie poster](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010134254/http:/typophile.com/node/33212 "Go to previous forum topic") [DIG! movie type ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010134254/http:/typophile.com/node/33219 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Joseph M

comments.content:
Mmmm... nice spacing and kerning. :^(

Nick Cooke

Yep, looks like they just used [Tagliente](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010134254/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/electric_typographer/tagliente/&sample_text=Polynesian%20Fantasy&sample_size=94) right out of the box, without kerning. The digitization and kerning are not great. Might I suggest [Spira](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010134254/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/font_bureau/spira_light_italic/&sample_text=Polynesian%20Fantasy&sample_size=60), [Artemisia](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010134254/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/elsner_flake/artemisia_light/&sample_text=Polynesian%20Fantasy&sample_size=55), and [Poetica](http://web.archive.org/web/20071010134254/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/poetica_chancery_i/&sample_text=Polynesian%20Fantasy&sample_size=70) as alternatives.
